intro: Hieracium onosmotrichum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium onosmotrichum is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in temperate climates.
